title: Liam Gallagher launches a SCATHING Twitter attack on a Manchester pub after his brother is thrown out
text:
Liam Gallagher launches a SCATHING Twitter attack on a Manchester pub after his brother is thrown out The Oasis rocker branded one staff member a 'c***' for enforcing the dress code Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Despite singing the words "don't look back in anger" he's never been one to greet any apparent slight with a wall of silence or an olive branch. 
And over the weekend one pub in Stockport found itself under attack from Liam Gallagher , as the Oasis frontman lashed out at the boozer for not serving one of his brothers out. 
Taking to Twitter on Sunday, the rock star, 44, slammed the Elizabethan pub in Greater Manchester after his brother was refused service, because he was wearing a tracksuit - referring to one member of staff as a 'c***'. Read More The Brit Awards is 40: How the music show became must-see car crash TV, thanks to the antics of Adele and Oasis He's not happy (Photo: Rex Features) 
Liam - a star who isn't afraid to air a forthright opinion or two - took to the micro-blogging site, and vented his fury at the supposed slight to the Gallagher family. 
Clearly unimpressed with the pub's stance on tracksuit bottoms, he blasted one "clown" who asked his brother to leave - though its unclear which Gallagher brother was trying to enjoy a quiet pint. 
Sharing his fury with his 1.43million followers, the former Beady Eye singer raged: "Is it any wonder that clown who just asked Rkid to leave the Elizabethen in Heston moor to leave coz he was wearing tracky bottoms C*** LG x [sic]." The Oasis star lashed out at a pub after his brother was refused service (Photo: Twitter) The Elizabethan pub in Stockport, Greater Manchester, managed to upset Liam (Photo: Facebook) 
Seemingly incredulous that his brother - possibly Paul, 51 - had been treated in such a manner he then warned fans to stay away from the boozer. 
Continuing the rant, he added: 'If you ever go to mcr heaton moor swerve the Elizabethen the bar mans won't let you in if you ain't got a Gucci bath robe on and f***ing wot [sic]" 
Responding to Liam's tweets, a spokesperson for The Elizabethan told the Manchester Evening News : “For the last seven years, we have consistently operated a no tracksuit rule at the pub, which is pretty standard practice. Read More Patsy Kensit, 49, sparks surgery rumours as she begs for a job on Corrie The word war came after one of the Gallagher clan was refused service as they were in a tracksuit (Photo: David M. Benett/Dave Benett/WireImage) 
"Overall this is something our regulars and locals want, however, occasionally it has proved unpopular with one or two people but we don’t look back in anger.” 
Some Twitter users backed Liam up, with @Garyb28b writing: "You have upset Liam Gallagher. Manchester royalty.' 
And even Hollyoaks star Kirsty-Leigh Porter couldn't resist having a playful joke with the pub, writing: "@The_Liz1 only you would go and piss the Gallagher's off," followed by a string of emojis. Read More
